chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J. Ebensperger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization. 

Absolute sobriety from alcohol except as allowed by agent. 

No contact with C.V.

AODA and follow through unless already done during confinement. 

Sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program assessment and follow through.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

DNA sample.

                      : Ct. 14 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF494: Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 5 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 6 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF697: Ct. 1 (Operator Flee-Elude Officer - Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1114: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF494: Ct. 4>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 5>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 6>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC and 1 yr ES - with 637 days credit. 
In 15CF697: Ct. 1>>7 yrs imprisonment - 4 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 744 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>10 yrs imprisonment - 4 yrs IC and 6 yrs ES - with 744 days credit. 
In 15CF1114: Ct. 1>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 2>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 3>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 
                      : Ct. 4>>6.5 yrs imprisonment - 3.5 yrs IC and 3 yrs ES - with 630 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES in ALL: AODA and follow through unless already done during confinement; sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program assessment and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; absolute sobriety from alcohol except as allowed by agent; no contact with victim C.V.; DNA sample/surcharge (1 surcharge per numbered file); CC including 3 DA surcharges. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITION OF ES in 15CF697: restitution of $10,506.37 to West Bend Mutual. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands def into custody of MCSD for transport to WSPS.
